TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {67763=At Harvard: 2013: Earned recognition on USA College Football Preseason All-America Third Team ... Selected to College Sports Madness Preseason All-Ivy League second team ... Named to Phil Steele Preseason All-Ivy League first team ... Tabbed to the All-Ivy League second team ... Named to NFF Hampshire Honor Society ... Holds Harvard's career scoring lead for kickers with 247 points (28 field goals, 163 extra points) ... Has 253 overall points in his career ... Stands second in team history with 28 career field goals ... Ranks second in Ivy League history among kickers in scoring and is eighth overall in points scored ... Made all seven field-goal attempts and was 29-of-29 on PATs for the year ... Went 6-of-6 on PAT attemps in opener at San Diego ... Nailed two 36-yard field goals and was 5-of-5 on PATs for 11 points against Brown ... Named Ivy Special Teams Player of the Week Sept. 30 ... Went 5-of-5 on PATs at Holy Cross ... Hit 36 and 28-yard field goals and was 4-of-4 on PATs at Cornell ... Drilled a 20-yard field goal and was 5-of-5 on extra points against Penn ... Hit a career-high and Harvard-record in The Game 48-yard field goal at Yale; finished with 10 points ... Tabbed to College Football Performance Awards Honor Roll Nov. 24. 2012: Major H recipient ... First team All-Ivy League at place kicker ... Set a single-season record for extra points with 52 ... Made 6-of-8 field goals on the year. 2011: Major H recipient ... Was 48-for-50 on extra point placements and 6-for-8 on field goals with a long of 42 ... Connected on field goals of 42 and 26 yards in a 41-31 win at Cornell ... Ran for a touchdown on a fake field goal in a win at Yale ... Ivy League Special Teams Player of the Week in a win over Yale after converting two field goals and four PATs. 2010: Earned the place kicking duties and ranked among the Ivy League's leaders in scoring ... Converted 9-of-15 field goals and 34-of-35 extra points ... Had a 43-yarder at Dartmouth ... Averaged 63.1 yards per kickoff with five touchbacks on 50 kickoffs ... Made both of his field goal attempts and all four extra point tries in the season opener against Holy Cross and was named the Ivy League co-Rookie of the Week on 9/20 ... Kicked a 38-yard field goal against Lehigh ... Ivy League Honor Roll and College Football Performance Awards National Placekicker of the Week on 11/1 ... Was perfect on kick placements at Dartmouth, going 3-for-3 on field goals. He converted a season-long 43-yard field goal in the first quarter and later added kicks of 27 and 35 yards. He also had a touchback on a kickoff ... Major H award winner., 70560=High School: Lettered in football, soccer and baseball at St. Margaret's Episcopal School (Calif.) and Phillips Exeter Academy (Mass.) … Senior captain in all three sports in final year at St. Margaret’s … 2008 east Valley Division Player of the Year … Maxpreps first team All-America and all-state … Earned all-league status as a soccer goalie and a baseball pitcher … Three-time league champion with 43-0 record … 2008 state champion … Led the nation in PATs in 2008 with 99 … School led the state in points with 743 … NEPSAC championship at Exeter in 2009 and earned all-league honors … Headmaster’s Honors … Brother, Eric, attends Harvard Law School., 227542=© Copyright 2014 Harvard University All Rights Reserved}
